abstract: Texas awakens the World Series with a ninth inning to remember, while St. Louis Manager Tony La Russa sets the head-scratching in motion.
snippet: Texas awakens the World Series with a ninth inning to remember, while St. Louis Manager Tony La Russa sets the head-scratching in motion.
lead_paragraph: The top of the ninth inning of Game 2 of the World Series was such a tiny sliver in an otherwise unremarkable game. Sure, the starting pitchers performed admirably amid reports that their profession was as obsolete as the iPhone 2, but by the time Albert Pujols polished off the last of his fruitless four at-bats, well, hanging with the "action" was getting tougher with every pitch.

headline.main: Leading Off: Rangers Go Bold, Just in Time
